meanings.definition: The quality or state of being jaded.
meanings.sent1: After watching too many movies in a row, he felt a sense of jadery.
meanings.sent2: Her constant complaints about work showed a clear sign of jadery.
meanings.sent3: The jadery in his voice made everyone realize he needed a break.
meanings.sent4: The jadery of the old book gave it a mysterious aura.
meanings.sent5: The jadery of the room was palpable, as if it had absorbed all the negative energy.

meanings.sent1: The slow progression of jadery in her attitude was noticeable to everyone.
meanings.sent2: His sudden jadery surprised his friends who knew him to be optimistic.
meanings.sent3: The jadery in her expression was like a storm brewing on the horizon.
meanings.sent4: The jadery of the situation crept in slowly, like a shadow at dusk.
meanings.sent5: The jadery of the conversation made it clear that they had been talking for too long.

meanings.definition: A feeling of weariness or boredom.
meanings.sent1: The jadery in her eyes showed she was tired of waiting.
meanings.sent2: His constant yawning was a clear sign of jadery during the lecture.
meanings.sent3: The jadery in his tone made the meeting seem longer than it was.
meanings.sent4: The jadery of the rainy day made her want to stay in bed.
meanings.sent5: The jadery of the repetitive task made it hard to focus on completing it.
